Authors:
Jia Wei Liu, MANAWASINGHE S ISHARA, xuan ni Liao, Jing Mao,
Zhang Yong Dong, Yongxin Shu, Ruvishika Shehali Jayawardena, Kevin D
Hyde, Mei Luo
Title:
Endophytic Colletotrichum species associated with Citrus
grandis cv ‘Tomentosa’ in China
Keywords:
2 new species, 6 new host records, Glomerellaceae,
phylogeny, taxonomy
Abstract:
Colletotrichum species are well-known pathogens, saprobes
and endophytes associated with Citrus species. However, little is known
about Colletotrichum as endophytes in Citrus grandis in China. In the
present study, ten endophytic Colletotrichum isolates were obtained from
cultivated C. grandis cv. ‘Tomentosa’ in Huazhou, Guangdong Province in
2019. The nuclear ribosomal internal transcribed spacer (ITS),
glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (gapdh), chitin synthase 1
(chs-1), actin (act), and beta-tubulin (β-tubulin) gene regions were
sequenced and employed to construct phylogenetic trees. Based on
morphology and combined multigene phylogeny, six Colletotrichum species
were identified with two new species, Colletotrichum guangdongense and
C. tomentosae. In addition, C. asianum, C. plurivorum, C. siamense, and
C. tainanense are identified as first reports on C. grandis. This study
provides the first comprehensive study on endophytic Colletotrichum
species on C. grandis cv. “Tomentosa” in China. These results will
improve the current knowledge of Colletotrichum species associated with
C. grandis.
